items.title: Oracle Database Administrator – Leader
tags: DBG_TECH1:techWeightMap:{python=0, other=5, dotnet=0, c=0, mobile=0, go=0, nodejs=0, bigdata-ml=0, ruby=0, apple=0, java=0, gamedev=0, php=0, embedded=0, frontend=0}
items.content:
Remote

Client Location: Remote
Position Type: Direct Hire (Perm or w2,1099, c2c)
Residency Requirements: US Citizens and all other parties authorized to work in the US are encouraged to apply.

We are looking for a seasoned Oracle Database Administrator with experience in the development and application-facing aspects of database administration (writing PL/SQL code, query tuning, data modeling). Experience in developing for large-scale production Oracle databases using public cloud infrastructure and services (AWS, Azure or GCP) is a big advantage.

Roles and responsibilities

  • Perform engineering, query, tuning, data modeling, schema design, architecture and configuration of mission critical Oracle databases.
  • Plan and implement large-scale Oracle migrations from on-premises to AWS and GCP.
  • Assist in modernizing existing application database backend to be fully cloud-native.
  • Work on Oracle versions 11g/12c, Golden Gate, DataGuard, RAC
  • Write complex PL/SQL stored procedures, functions and packages.
  • Monitor and optimize database performance using index tuning, disk optimization, and other methods.
  • Implement, configure, and troubleshoot database replication.
  • Work closely with other technology counterparts inside and outside the organization including storage, network for a comprehensive solution to build a scalable DB infrastructure.

Your Qualifications

  • Three years’ experience as a development focused Oracle DBA working with application teams.
  • Current experience with schema design and modeling.
  • At least three years’ experience as a development focused Oracle DBA working with application teams.
  • Experience in Linux including troubleshooting commands, sh/awk/perl.
  • Complete and detailed understanding of Oracle database architecture and performance tuning principals
  • Experience with data replication technologies such as GoldenGate, Oracle Streams, DataGuard is a big advantage.
  • Experience with data movement using EXPDP, IMPDP, DB backup using RMAN.
  • Performance troubleshooting, monitoring and tuning skills including reviewing and analyzing AWR reports and query execution plans.
  • Experience with schema design and modeling.
  • High level of confidence to perform DB switch overs, failovers, recovery
Apply for job

items.title: RebelMouse: Senior Data Base Administrator (DBA)
items.content:
Senior Data Base Administrator (DBA)

Who we are
Rebelmouse is a small and fully distributed team of talented people all over the world!
Our mission is to build a platform to accelerate migration to the modern age of social 

Who We are looking for
Proactive and talented person passioned about speed and performance.

What you will do
Building, analyzing, maintaining, improving and innovating high loaded data bases and everything around it.

Your experience
  • 5+ years experience working as a DBA on enterprise products
  • Strong hands-on experience with MySQL, MongoDB, Redis, Memcached;
  • Experience with optimizing DB performance
  • Experience in building DRP
  • Experience with AWS
  • Experience in building and maintaining high performing DBs

Our Benefits
  • Flexible schedule - done work is the only measurement of success
  • Paid sick days
  • 1 week of PTO after 3 month of work
  • Annual bonuses

items.title: NetProtect: Senior MySQL Database Administrator
items.content:
Senior MySQL Database Administrator

NetProtect is a leading provider of consumer VPN offerings including IPVanish, SaferVPN, StrongVPN, and Encrypt.me as well as SugarSync, a leading online backup service.  We are looking to add to our team of world-class engineers.

Job Description:

Responsible for designing, maintenance, monitoring, performance tuning, backup and security of NetProtect's databases.  Assist engineers on all aspects of NetProtect business including data modeling, normalization, table design, query optimization, data warehousing and reporting. 
  • be strategic, self-motivated, creative, and highly communicative individual, capable of adapting quickly to a fast-paced and evolving environment
  • comfortable working with diverse and distributed teams
  • work closely with development and engineering teams 
  • manage MySQL in production/QA/dev environments including backup & recovery, health monitoring and diagnostics
  • use, write and maintain automation and reporting tools 
  • identify and recommend tools and services for managing database infrastructure where needed
  • make technical recommendations, develops and implements policies, standards, and procedures to ensure the security, integrity, and efficiency of the enterprise database(s)·

Job Requirements and Experience:
  • 5+ years of experience in database designing, installation, monitoring and administration of very large mysql databases
  • degree in computer science, software engineering or equivalent related experience
  • data modelling, schema design, performance tuning
  • experience in msyql mirroring, clustering and failover strategies
  • experience with data warehousing and ETL processes
  • familiarity with RDS, Postgres and other database technologies would be an asset
  • familiarity with SOX and PCI compliance would be an asset

Does this sound like you? We'd love to meet. Please contact us at hiring@netprotect.com.

items.title: Percona | REMOTE WORLDWIDE | MySQL Database Engineer | Full-time | https://www.percona.com ...
items.content:
Percona | REMOTE WORLDWIDE | MySQL Database Engineer | Full-time | https://www.percona.com/about-percona/careers/database-engin...

Percona is a remote-first company and we were voted in the 10 top companies that are hiring people to work from anywhere in the world (CNBC). We are an industry leader in providing elite services, training and software for MySQL®, MariaDB®, MongoDB®, PostgreSQL® and other open source databases in on-premise and cloud environments.

Our Database Engineers are a team of experts who love to solve the toughest challenges and help our customers improve their overall database infrastructures.

Top skills required: MySQL, Linux, cloud services or hosting providers, English-speaking

items.content:
Database Administrator

About this job

Job type: Full-time
Experience level: Mid-Level
Role: Database Administrator, System Administrator
Company: Chainbridge Technologies – No office location

Remote details

Preferred Timezone: (GMT-05:00) Eastern Time

Technologies

sysadmin
database
azure

Job description

We are seeking a Database Administrator for immediate hire. This position is contingent upon contract award and funding.  This position will require the ability to obtain a Public Trust Clearance. To be considered, you must include your full address, phone number, and current email on your resume. 

Due to current Government Contract Requirements: ONLY US CITIZENS CAN BE CONSIDERED.  NON-CITIZEN applicants, including Green Card Holders, will not be reviewed. 

Responsibilities:

  • Install and maintain the performance of database servers.
  • Develop processes for optimizing database security.
  • Set and maintain database standards.
  • Manage database access.
  • Performance tuning of database systems.
  • Install, upgrade, and manage database applications.
  • Diagnose and troubleshoot database errors.
  • Recommend and implement emerging database technologies.
  • Create and manage database reports, visualizations, and dashboards.
  • Create automation for repeating database tasks.
  • Be available for on-call support as needed.

Skills:

  • Strong command of SQL and SQL server tools
  • Advanced knowledge of database security, backup and recovery, and performance monitoring standards
  • Understanding of relational and dimensional data modeling
  • Ability to operate in a fast-paced work environment with immediate turnaround and attention to detail
  • Proficient with Azure Servers
  • Ability to multi-task, manage time effectively, and have strong organizational skills
  • Writing skills needed to communicate with software developers
  • Must be proactive with work product and possess learning agility

The interview process includes both oral and written components. The written component is an online skills test and is taken before the oral interview process begins. Candidates scoring less than 75% will not be contacted for an interview. 

Chainbridge Technologies is an Equal Opportunity Employer. Employment decisions are made without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, disability, veteran status or other characteristics protected by law.

Easy apply

About Chainbridge Technologies

We are a small, tight-knit IT company based just outside of Washington DC.  Chainbridge Technologies is the leader in developing custom emergency response systems for private and federal customers.  We are seeking passionate developers who want to make a difference- if this sounds like your next career, we want to hear from you! 

 Chainbridge Technologies is an Equal Opportunity Employer. Employment decisions are made without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, disability, veteran status or other characteristics protected by law.
